snippet: Beverly Emers, who dropped out of high school and served nine stints in jail, enrolled in college after her young son asked her, “When are you graduating?”...
abstract: Children’s Aid Society, one of eight organizations supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, helps Beverly Emers, single mother who overcame drug addiction and criminal history, with food and household expenses.
lead_paragraph: Beverly Emers, who dropped out of high school and served nine stints in jail, enrolled in college after her young son asked her, “When are you graduating?”

headline.print_headline: Trading the ‘Ugliness’ of Drugs and Jail for Motherhood and College
headline.main: Trading the ‘Ugliness’ of Drugs and Jail for Motherhood and College

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
